title: Contractors themselves will topple Congress govt., says Somanna
content: The Minister recalls their allegation of corruption against the previous BJP regime and says that they are now targeting their ‘own govt.’

title: Indian EVMs not connected to internet, Wi-Fi, says ECI amid Tulsi Gabbard’s comments
content: EC sources said some countries use Electronic Voting Systems which are a mix of multiple systems, machines and processes, including various private networks like Internet

title: Summer showers raise hopes of Idukki cardamom farmers
content: Major cardamom-growing areas have received four spells of summer rain. Officials at ICAR-KVK say farmers can start fertilizer application on the plants

title: Tri-commissionerate records over 4.3 lakh wrong-side driving violations in first quarter
content: Hyderabad traffic police begins mapping hotspots for ANPR camera installation aiming to automate challans and analyse the u-turns and road infrastructure to improve safety

title: Despite empty coffers, NDA govt. in A.P. trying to fulfil poll promises, says  Naidu
content: ‘Thalliki Vandanam’ scheme will be launched soon, followed by disbursal of aid for farmers in May, announces Chief Minister

title: Coast Guard seizes 400-450 gunny bags of smuggled Betel nuts
content: Each bag weighed 50-60 kg and the vessel and crew are to be handed over to Customs authorities for probe.

title: AIADMK And BJP Team Up Again For Tamil Nadu Polls Under EPS' Leadership
content: Tamil Nadu's opposition party AIADMK and the BJP will contest the state elections together under the leadership of former chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said today at a joint press conference in Chennai.

title: "No Conditions, Demands": Amit Shah As AIADMK Back In BJP-Led Alliance
content: Renewal of the BJP-AIADMK alliance in Tamil Nadu does not come with conditions from either side, Home Minister Amit Shah said Friday, as he and senior leaders from the Tamil party announced plans to contest next year's election together.

title: "He Is Still...": Amit Shah On K Annamalai 'Being Removed' For AIADMK Alliance
content: Refusing to be drawn into the speculation surrounding K Annamalai's removal as the Tamil Nadu president of the BJP, Union Home Minister and senior party leader Amit Shah has said Mr Annamalai still holds the post.

title: China Raises Tariffs On US Goods To 125% As Trade War Worsens
content: China's action came after Donald Trump raised the tariffs for Beijing to 145 per cent, further escalating the ongoing trade war between the top two economies.

title: Woman Friend In Washroom, 38-Year-Old Techie Dies By Suicide At Noida Hotel
content: A software engineer was found dead in a hotel room in Uttar Pradesh's Noida last night. Umesh Kumar allegedly died by suicide while his woman friend with whom he was staying at the hotel was in the washroom.

title: Who Was Agustin Escobar, Siemens Executive Killed In New York Chopper Crash
content: Agustin Escobar, a top Spanish executive at technology company Siemens, was among six people killed in a helicopter crash on Thursday.

title: IPL LIVE: Dhoni Faces Rs 27.75 Crore Headache On CSK Captaincy Comeback
content: Chennai Super Kings vs Kolkata Knight Riders LIVE Score, IPL 2025: MS Dhoni is all set to make his comeback as CSK captain, as they face KKR at Chepauk.

title: 'Have Any Shame?' Couple, Sitting On Scooter In Bengaluru, Assaulted
content: The video shows the man, wearing an orange t-shirt, and the woman, wearing a burqa, in a heated exchange with some men, one of whom was seen to be capturing a video of the woman.

title: After India Outreach, China Calls On Europe To Resist American "Bullying"
content: China has called on the European Union to join hands to resist "unilateral bullying" by the US, referring to the sweeping (and staggering) 145 per cent tariffs imposed by Donald Trump on Chinese imports.

title: Tamil Minister's "Disgusting" Comment On Sex Workers Triggers Furious Row
content: Tamil Nadu's Forest Minister K Ponmudy's misogynistic remarks - laced with caste undertones - have landed Chief Minister MK Stalin in trouble, inviting fierce criticism from women's rights activists, the opposition, and within his DMK.

title: World's Highest Bridge In China: Cuts Travel Time From 1 Hour To 1 Minute
content: China will open the Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge in June, becoming the world's highest bridge, drastically reducing travel time across a massive canyon at a cost of Rs 2200 Crore, and surpassing the Eiffel Tower in height.

title: 14x14 Feet Cell, 24-Hour Surveillance: How Tahawwur Rana Is Being Held
content: Measuring just 14 feet by 14 feet, this cell - under CCTV and manned by round-the-clock guards - is where Tahawwur Hussain Rana, a key accused in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, is being held.

title: "That Is Not Acceptable": Fuming Rajat Patidar Puts Blame Of Defeat On...
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper Rajat Patidar was not amused with the way his batters threw away their wickets in a heap when thing were cruise control.

title: In Tahawwur Rana Probe, An ISI Link, And Two Names: Major Iqbal, Sameer Ali
content: As Tahawwur Hussain Rana, key conspirator in the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks, sits in a high-security cell in New Delhi, fresh interrogations and years-old indictments are peeling back layers of one of the most high-profile cases in Indian history.

title: 'Nitish be made deputy PM': Is BJP planning JD(U) supremo's 'honourable exit'?
content: Speculation is growing within Bihar's NDA alliance as the BJP may be considering a significant shift in leadership post-elections. The BJP might propose an "honourable exit" for Nitish Kumar, potentially relocating him to a central cabinet position or another constitutional role.

title: AIADMK, BJP announce alliance for Tamil Nadu assembly elections
content: The AIADMK and BJP have officially announced their alliance for the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections during a joint press conference. Amit Shah confirmed Edappadi K Palaniswami will lead the NDA in the state. Shah dismissed reports of AIADMK's demands, emphasizing the alliance's long-standing history and its permanent nature, highlighting PM Modi and Jayalalithaa's past collaboration.

title: MS Dhoni calls his longtime teammate a 'traitor'
content: Chennai Super Kings face a setback as Ruturaj Gaikwad's elbow injury sidelines him for the remainder of the IPL season. MS Dhoni will reclaim captaincy, confirmed by coach Stephen Fleming. Ahead of the KKR clash, Dhoni and former teammate Dwayne Bravo shared a light moment. Dhoni, who captained CSK from 2008 to 2023 and led them to five IPL titles, had handed over the reins to Gaikwad ahead of the 2024 season.

title: Jeff Bezos’ Mar-a-Lago dinner led to Melania’s $40M Amazon Prime project
content: Melania Trump has secured a $40 million deal with Amazon Prime Video for a documentary chronicling her White House life, directed by Brett Ratner. The film, slated for a mid-2025 release, will feature exclusive insights into her daily life, with appearances by Donald and Barron Trump.

title: Why is Ruturaj Gaikwad not playing CSK vs KKR match?
content: Chennai Super Kings faces a blow as Ruturaj Gaikwad is out of IPL 2025 due to an elbow fracture sustained during a match against Rajasthan Royals. Stephen Fleming confirmed MS Dhoni will reclaim captaincy. Dhoni included Rahul Tripathi and Anshul Kamboj in the playing XI. Dhoni emphasized the importance of winning and focusing on the basics after losing several matches.

title: Agustin Escobar, family boarded doomed NYC copter to celebrate kid's birthday: Report
content: Agustin Escober, a Siemens executive, his wife, and their three children tragically died in a helicopter crash in the Hudson River during a celebratory tour of New York City. The helicopter, operated by a company with a history of safety incidents, crashed shortly after reporting the need for fuel. The incident is under investigation.

title: Captain Dhoni breaks another IPL record to become ...
content: MS Dhoni is back as captain for Chennai Super Kings. He replaces Ruturaj Gaikwad due to injury. Dhoni is now the oldest captain in IPL history. The announcement was made before the match against Kolkata Knight Riders. Dhoni emphasized focusing on the basics. Stephen Fleming expressed faith in Dhoni's leadership. Fans are excited about Dhoni leading the team again.

title: US: We will revoke or deny Visa if your social media posts are in support of ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts can now impact visa decisions. The agency will scrutinize accounts, potentially denying visas or residency to individuals posting content deemed anti-Semitic or supportive of designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah. This policy, effective immediately, extends to student visas and Green Card applications, raising concerns about freedom of expression.

title: 'India-US could finalise partial bilateral trade deal amid 90-day tariff truce'
content: India and the US are working towards finalizing a portion of their Bilateral Trade Agreement during the 90-day tariff pause initiated by the US. Negotiations have commenced, with both nations aiming for a mutually beneficial outcome. India is actively engaged, seeking to finalize initial phases by September-October, targeting a significant increase in bilateral trade to $500 billion by 2030.

title: MS Dhoni gives major update on Ruturaj Gaikwad, reveals ...
content: In an electrifying atmosphere at Chepauk, Kolkata Knight Riders won the toss and opted to field against Chennai Super Kings. A significant blow for CSK as Ruturaj Gaikwad is ruled out of the tournament due to injury, with MS Dhoni taking over the captaincy. Amid the thunderous cheers and electrifying atmosphere, Dhoni shared a major update on Ruturaj Gaikwad.

title: Captain Canuck makes a comeback in Canada and this time it is Donald Trump effect
content: Canada's superhero, Captain Canuck, is making a comeback amidst political tensions with the U.S. under Donald Trump. Fueled by Trump's remarks about Canada becoming the 51st state, the comic portrays Captain Canuck as a symbol of Canadian sovereignty. Creator Richard Comely notes the renewed interest reflects a desire for a distinct Canadian identity.

title: Indian Consulate in Melbourne vandalised with graffiti on main entrance
content: The Indian Consulate General in Melbourne was vandalized with graffiti at its St Kilda Road location. The incident, occurring around 1:00 am on April 10, prompted a response from Victoria Police.

title: 'Indians deserved it': What Rana allegedly told Headley after 26/11 attack
content: Tahawwur Hussain Rana, the 64-year-old Canadian of Pakistani origin, was extradited from the US to India to face trial for his role in the 2008 Mumbai attacks, which killed 166 people. Accused of aiding co-conspirator David Headley, Rana allegedly praised the attackers. His extradition, after a lengthy legal battle, is hailed as a major step in securing justice for the victims.

title: Top 5 news of the day: AIADMK-BJP alliance; gold prices surge and more
content: AIADMK and BJP have solidified their alliance for the 2026 Tamil Nadu elections, with Amit Shah confirming the NDA will contest under PM Modi nationally and Edappadi K Palaniswami in the state. Meanwhile, gold prices surged to a record high amid US-China trade tensions, and MS Dhoni has returned to captain Chennai Super Kings after Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury.

title: Exclusive: RCB fan who became a world champion
content: Pranav Venkatesh, the World Junior Chess Champion, has his sights set on becoming the World Chess Champion. The 18-year-old from Chennai balances chess with academics and enjoys cricket. He admires Magnus Carlsen and Viswanathan Anand. Pranav is preparing for upcoming tournaments in Spain and Dubai. He skipped his board exams for the championship.

title: 'Will leverage Annamalai's organisational skills in national framework': Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded K. Annamalai for his exceptional contributions as the Tamil Nadu BJP unit chief, highlighting his efforts in promoting party policies and programs. Shah announced that the BJP would utilize Annamalai's organizational skills at the national level.

title: Amit Shah says AIADMK made 'no demand' as party reunites with BJP-led NDA
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced the AIADMK's return to the NDA for the upcoming Tamil Nadu assembly election, stating that the AIADMK had no preconditions for re-joining. Shah emphasized that the BJP would not interfere in AIADMK's internal affairs and that the election would be contested under Edapaddi K Palaniswami's leadership.

title: Vande Bharat Express gets stoppage at Haveri
content: Minister of State for Railways V. Somanna says that Vande Bharat services will soon be flagged off from three more districts

title: Space under Edamalaipatti Pudur bridge turns into dumping ground
content: The bridge links two major residential neighbourhoods and weekly shandy markets are held along the roads on the Edamalaipatti Pudur side, which add to the solid waste generation

title: Karuvannur scam: HC directive to police to conduct investigation against all those included in ED report
content: If the investigation officers tried to shield any politicians or officials, they will have to face the charge of dereliction of duties and disciplinary proceedings, cautions court

title: Start-up incubated at IIT-M develops fast EV charger for heavy vehicles
content: The charger has been certified by Automotive Research Association of India for its efficiency and safety

title: Special law soon for protection of Backward Classes in Andhra Pradesh, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: BCs have been the backbone of the TDP ever since its inception, the Chief Minister says, adding that efforts will continue to be made to uplift them

title: Tiruchi Railway Division sets record in freight loading in 2024-2025 fiscal
content: The division accomplished its highest ever loading of 14.76 million tonnes surpassing the target of 14.15 million tonnes and earned ₹827.03 crore during 2024-2025 fiscal.

title: Kannada theatreperson Raghunandana’s book gets V.M. Inamdar award
content: The book Tuytavella Navyadatta: Andattara Uyyale…Mattu Adara Sutta is an examination of the sonnets of D.R. Bendre in his collection, Uyyale, and a philosophical, political reflection on the world in general.

title: Munambam: Waqf Tribunal questions validity of Board’s claim over land
content: Waqf Chairman points out that there could not be any issue with the sale of the property as it was not registered as Waqf when the sale happened.

title: Here's why KL Rahul did 'mera ground hai' celebration vs RCB
content: KL Rahul's magnificent unbeaten 93 propelled Delhi Capitals to a six-wicket victory over Royal Challengers Bengaluru at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Thursday. Rahul's match-winning knock, combined with his intimate knowledge of the ground, guided his team to victory. He celebrated with a gesture inspired by the movie Kantara, declaring the stadium as his home turf.

title: Mumbai to Dubai in 2 hours? All about rail project connecting India to UAE
content: An ambitious proposal envisions a high-speed underwater train connecting Mumbai and Dubai, potentially slashing travel time to two hours. Spearheaded by the UAE's National Advisor Bureau Limited, the 2,000-kilometer subsea rail corridor aims to revolutionize transcontinental travel. Beyond passenger transport, it plans to facilitate goods movement, strengthening trade relations and setting a precedent for future global transportation projects.

title: Social worker assaulted, held 'hostage' by IRCTC pantry staff on Gitanjali Express
content: Passengers on the Gitanjali Express faced consequences for complaining about the food quality and price. IRCTC staffers allegedly assaulted passengers, holding a social worker hostage for over an hour until RPF intervened. Satyajit Burman, the social worker, filed a complaint, leading to a case against seven IRCTC employees.

title: Musk says Starship will reach Mars by 2026 with Optimus robots onboard
content: Elon Musk revealed his plan to send Tesla's Optimus robots to Mars. SpaceX's Starship rocket will carry the robots. The mission aims to prepare Mars for human habitation. Experts are skeptical about the 2026 timeline. Government support could help advance the Mars mission. This mission marks a significant step in space exploration.

title: Burqa-clad woman stopped from speaking to man from other community in B'luru
content: In Bengaluru's Chandra Layout, police arrested four individuals for moral policing. A woman, wearing a Burqa, was confronted by community members for speaking with a man from a different community while on a scooter. The woman filed a complaint, leading to the arrests, including a juvenile. Authorities confirmed that no violence occurred during the incident. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Delhi businessman kills wife, dumps body in drain
content: In Delhi's Dwarka, a property dealer and his security guard have been arrested for allegedly murdering the dealer's 47-year-old wife, Seema Singh. She was reported missing, and her body was found in a drain on March 15. Identification was made possible through a nose pin, leading police to the husband.

title: Chicago Cubs acquire Tom Cosgrove from San Diego Padres for cash
content: Chicago Cubs has acquired Tom Cosgrove for their minor baseball league, He was acquired from San Diego Padres for cash, A report suggested that Chicago Cubs could also be interested in Kyle Hendricks.

title: 'I was cheated': Eknath Shinde takes veiled dig at 'Fukat Baburao' Uddhav
content: During a rally in Sangola, Eknath Shinde criticized Uddhav Thackeray, accusing him of deceiving people with a facade of innocence and implying they were misled by his seemingly innocent demeanor for years. Shinde inaugurated a Babasaheb Ambedkar statue and memorial, emphasizing his commitment to public service and assuring that schemes like "Ladki Bahin" will continue despite opposition claims.

title: 60 Indians forced into 'cyber slavery' rescued from Myanmar; 5 agents held
content: Cybercrime officials rescued 60 Indian nationals from Myanmar, victims of forced cyber slavery under false job promises. Maharashtra Police arrested five agents, including a foreign national, involved in trafficking victims from Thailand to Myanmar. The victims were coerced into carrying out digital arrest and investment scams in guarded compounds controlled by armed groups.

title: Watch: MP hospital's 'Dr Death' seen entering operation theatre wearing suit
content: In Madhya Pradesh's Damoh district, a fake doctor, Narendra Vikramaditya Yadav, is accused of impersonating a British cardiologist and conducting unauthorized heart surgeries at Mission Hospital, leading to seven patient deaths. CCTV footage shows Yadav in formal attire in the operation theatre. Authorities have sealed the cath lab, and Yadav faces charges of forgery and medical negligence.

title: 'Jaat' film holds well but faces competition from 'Good Bad Ugly'
content: Sunny Deol's 'Jaat' is receiving positive reviews after its theatrical release, following the success of 'Gadar 2'. The film earned Rs 9.5 crore on its opening day, performing well in northern regions. However, it faces competition from Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly' in the south. By Friday afternoon, 'Jaat' had collected Rs 1.39 crore, bringing its total to Rs 10.

title: Connor McDavid’s wife shares what he did after his victory over Blues
content: Connor McDavid made a surprise return against the St. Louis Blues. His wife, Lauren Kyle, shared a picture of him relaxing at home with their dog after the game. McDavid had been out with an injury. The Oilers had lost two of their last three games before his return. Coach Kris Knoblauch said McDavid insisted on playing.

title: 'Woman herself invited trouble': Allahabad HC grants bail to rape accused
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a rape accused, stating the victim 'invited trouble' by going to a bar, consuming alcohol, and then accompanying the accused. The court noted the victim's maturity as a postgraduate student and the lack of conclusive medical evidence of sexual assault.

title: 'Parivar ka saath, parivar ka vikas': PM Modi's dig at opposition in Varanasi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Varanasi, criticized opposition parties for prioritizing family interests over public service, emphasizing his government's commitment to inclusive development. He inaugurated multiple projects worth Rs 3,880 crore, highlighting Varanasi's transformation into a healthcare hub and a model for blending development with heritage. Modi also mentioned India's efforts to host the 2036 Olympic Games.

title: Xi Jinping warns of ‘self-isolation’ in first response to Trump tariffs
content: President Xi Jinping has cautioned against tariff wars, emphasizing that confrontation within the international community could lead to isolation. He urged the EU to join China in opposing unilateralism and economic coercion, implicitly referencing the United States' trade policies.

title: After being caught cheating, Class 7 student hits teacher with iron rod
content: In Hyderabad, a 12-year-old government school student attacked a teacher with an iron rod after being caught cheating during final exams. The teacher sustained a minor head injury but is out of danger. While an assault case was registered, the teacher is considering withdrawing the complaint, but the juvenile will be produced before the juvenile justice board.

title: Mizoram civil society body seeks refugee management policy
content: The Central Young Mizo Association’s resolution follows restrictions on the movement and trade by Myanmar refugees in the Champhai and Lawngtlai districts

title: Karnataka Cabinet clears platform-based gig workers Bill
content: The Bill, which emphasizes the rights of gig workers, proposes a welfare fee of 1-5% of the payout to the worker during each transaction. All sums received under the welfare will go to the welfare fund for the workers.

title: Kerala to have more new polling booths following ECI cap on voter numbers per booth
content: The concept of ‘auxiliary polling stations/booths’ will be done away with, to be replaced by new permanent booths

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Karaikal federation demands regularisation of contractual PRTC workers
content: The federation condemned the recruitment of new temporary staff by the PRTC stating that the claims of long-serving contractual employees were being ignored

title: Pollution Board issues advisory to Pithampur plant for essential works ahead of Union Carbide waste incineration
content: According to the advisory, some essential works needed to be carried out at the Pithampur plant, and once these are completed, the process of burning the remaining waste will begin at this unit

title: Street hawkers' body urges Centre to issue national guidelines to protect vendors from heatwaves
content: The NHF demanded that the government integrate vendor protection measures into the National Disaster Management Authority’s (NDMA) guidelines and ensure state and urban bodies implement them.

title: Apartments, not individual houses, take to BBMP’s multilevel mechanical car parking move
content: Without a policy that will penalize roadside parking of cars in the residential bylanes, it is unlikely that builders of individual houses will invest extra to put up a multilevel mechanical car parking facility.

title: Police use batons, water cannons at Congress rally in Patna
content: The rally was organised upon the completion of "Palayan roko, naukri do (stop migration, give jobs) pada-yatra", a drive aimed at mobilising the State's youth on the issues of unemployment

title: MMU-affiliated Imams read resolution against Waqf Act in J&K mosques
content: Meanwhile, the police foiled an attempted protest by PDP leaders, who wanted to march towards Lal Chowk over the Waqf issue

title: Daily Quiz | On Dalit activists
content: To mark Jyotiba Phule’s birth anniversary, here’s a quiz on historical figures in Dalit activism and their contributions to social justice movements

title: BJP should fight Trinamool Congress politically; not target people: Saket Gokhale on MGNREGS dues on West Bengal
content: On April 10, the Calcutta High Court directed the Central Government to explain why the MGNREG Act should not be prospectively implemented in West Bengal, excluding four districts

title: Watch: PM Modi’s meeting with Trump in U.S. helped clinch Tahawwur Rana extradition: former Foreign Secretary
content: Harsh Vardhan Shringla says Rana’s extradition can open up a new era of cooperation in counter-terrorism with U.S.

title: Rahul poses 3 questions on jobs to PM; BJP calls it 'strategy to distort reality'
content: Rahul Gandhi has criticized PM Modi's commitment to tackling unemployment, alleging the abandonment of the 'Employment Linked Incentive' scheme. He accused Modi of favoring big corporations over small businesses. The BJP retaliated, citing significant job creation under Modi's government and a decrease in youth unemployment, while also defending the ELI program and attacking Congress's past record.

title: Stock market today: Sensex surges over 1,100 points, Nifty nears 22,700
content: Indian equity markets surged on Friday, mirroring a global rebound and fueled by value buying across sectors. The Sensex soared over 1244 points, while the Nifty 50 climbed more than 400 points, driven by positive domestic cues and expectations of steady inflation. Experts suggest long-term investors consider selective buying in financials and pharmaceuticals.

title: Legs, waist shackled: US releases first pic of Tahawwur Rana’s handover to NIA
content: In a significant step towards justice for the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, the United States has extradited Tahawwur Hussain Rana to India. Rana, a key accused, faces multiple charges including conspiracy and murder for his alleged role in the attacks. The extradition follows years of legal proceedings and marks a critical moment for the victims and their families.

title: 'Toilet King of Punjab': CM Mann, AAP trolled over restroom inauguration plaques
content: The Punjab government's 'Sikhya Kranti' initiative is facing social media backlash for installing inauguration plaques even for minor repairs like school toilets. Critics accuse AAP leaders of seeking undue credit and wasting taxpayer money.

title: 'Gauti bhai has helped me understand my potential': Washington Sundar
content: Washington Sundar, a versatile all-rounder, faces the challenge of limited game time in the IPL. Despite his ability to bat anywhere and bowl anytime, he's struggled for consistent opportunities. In a candid interview with the TimesofIndia.com, the 25-year-old speaks on the Impact Player rule, the difficulties of maintaining rhythm, and the crucial support from India head coach Gautam Gambhir.

title: Son of vegetable vendor breaks national archery record at just 11
content: Sohit Kumar, an 11-year-old archer from Jabalpur, has set a national record by scoring 710 out of 720 points at the Under-15 National Archery Championship. Overcoming adversity, with his father selling vegetables on crutches, Sohit aims for the 2028 LA Olympics. His coach recognized his exceptional talent, paving the way for his early entry into the archery academy.

title: CSK vs KKR: Team prediction, pitch report, weather update
content: MS Dhoni is set to captain Chennai Super Kings against Kolkata Knight Riders after Ruturaj Gaikwad was ruled out due to an elbow fracture. CSK coach Stephen Fleming confirmed Gaikwad's injury, sustained in Guwahati. Dhoni, who handed over the captaincy to Gaikwad this season, previously led CSK to five IPL titles.

title: Who was Agustín Escobar? Siemens executive killed with family in NYC helicopter crash
content: A sightseeing helicopter tour over New York ended tragically when it crashed into the Hudson River, killing all six people on board. Among the deceased were Agustín Escobar, a high-profile Siemens executive, his wife, and their three young children. The helicopter went down near Pier 40 after a section of the rotor broke off mid-air.

title: Meat diet vs vegan diet: Twin's experiment uncovers ‘shocking results’
content: The Turner Twins did a new health experiment. This time, Ross and Hugo compared meat and vegan diets. They checked how these diets affected their vitamin levels. Hugo followed a vegan diet. Ross ate a meat-based diet. After six months, tests showed plant-based vitamins had positive effects. Hugo's Omega-3 and D3 levels improved. However, Hugo struggled with the vegan diet.

title: Three more arrested in Varanasi gang rape case
content: PM Modi received a detailed briefing about the case and asked officials to take the strictest possible action against those involved, according to an official statement

title: SC directs Centre, Bihar Govt to report on clearing illegal constructions along Ganges banks
content: A Bench also sought to know the number of existing encroachments as on date aside from the manner and time period in which the authorities proposed to remove them

title: TMC MP Mahua Moitra moves SC challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: Ms. Moitra, who filed her plea on April 9, has said the controversial amendment not only suffered from serious procedural lapses but also violated several fundamental rights enshrined in the Constitution

title: Satara ruler Pratapsinh Bhosale started 1st school for women, Mahatma Phule emulated him: Udayanraje
content: Mr. Bhosale's remarks drew a sharp reaction from the opposition with Maharashtra Congress president Harshvardhan Sapkal accusing him of distorting history

title: Railways earned additional ₹8,913 crore in five years by withdrawing senior citizens' concession: RTI
content: The data of passengers as well as revenue generated from them suggested that 31.35 crore senior citizens travelled paying an additional amount of ₹8,913 crore owing to suspension of concessions

title: More than 60 Indians forced into ‘cyber slavery’ rescued from Myanmar; 5 arrested
content: Maharashtra cyber wing-police rescues Indian nationals trafficked to Myanmar for cyber fraud; arrests agents and foreign national

title: Supreme Court reserves verdict on former Karnataka CM B.S. Yediyurappa’s plea against revival of corruption case
content: The veteran BJP leader had filed a plea against a Karnataka High Court order, dated January 5, 2021, reviving a corruption case against him.

title: Caste census report placed before Karnataka Cabinet
content: It has been nearly a decade since the survey was completed, but discussions around it has been delayed owing to pressure from the dominant Vokkaliga and Lingayat communities

title: CMRL pay-off case: Special Court to issue notice to Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan’s daughter Veena Thaikkandiyil
content: Decision to issue notice was taken after court found that prima-facie offence was made out against the respondents after perusing final complaint filed by SFIO

title: Transshipment cargo from Bangladesh grew by 46% from FY24 to FY25 at Bengal’s Petrapole: Official data
content: India had allowed transshipment of export cargo from Bangladesh to third countries via Indian land customs stations, and subsequently through Indian ports and airports since June 29, 2020

title: Massive security and traffic arrangements across Hyderabad for Hanuman Jayanti and IPL Match on Saturday
content: Nampally is likely to see traffic congestion as a public meeting titled ‘The Waqf Protection: Future Challenges and Roadmap’ is scheduled at 7 p.m. at Nehru Auditorium

title: MUMBAI 1, single card for public transportation in Mumbai to be launched soon
content: CM Fadnavis said that the single card can be used for travelling by Metro, Mono Rail, suburban local trains and public transport buses and added the “architecture” of the card will be ready in a month

title: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq claims he is under house arrest, was prevented from offering Friday prayers
content: The Mirwaiz posted a copy of a resolution formulated by the Mutahida Majlis Ulema (MMU) -- an amalgam of several religious bodies -- against the Waqf Amendment Act.

title: At least 25 killed in lightning strikes, hailstorms in several districts of Bihar
content: The IMD has issued an ‘orange alert’ for a number of districts, including Darbhanga, East Champaran, Nalanda and Patna; forecast heavy rainfall April 10 and April 11

title: India sees ‘urgency’ in finalising US, UK, EU trade pacts: S. Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar said that the US’s tariffs have “focused our minds on the need for correcting a certain skewed nature of our openness to the global economy”.

title: 26/11 Mumbai attacks: Tahawwur Rana likely devised similar plans for other cities, NIA to court
content: The NIA said Rana’s custody was required to piece together the full scope of the conspiracy, and submitted he was required to be taken to various locations for retracing the events that took place 17 years ago

title: PM Modi pushes for ‘strictest action’ in Varanasi gangrape case
content: Mr. Modi is on a one-day visit to his parliamentary constituency, Varanasi, in Uttar Pradesh. This is his 50th visit to the Lok Sabha seat he has represented since 2014.

title: Fire engulfs three floors of residential tower in Surat, 18 rescued
content: The fire started around 8 a.m. on the seventh floor of the multi-storey Happy Excellencia building located in the city’s Vesu area and soon engulfed two more top floors

title: Dhinakaran wants Ponmudy dropped from Cabinet over misogynistic remarks
content: “The indecent remarks made by Minister Ponmudy on women are condemnable. Chief Minister M.K. Stalin should think about whether he should continue to be a Minister,” Mr. Dhinakaran said in a social media post

title: Centre giving coarse rice and not fine rice: Telangana Civil Supplies Minister to BJP
content: A Tricolour Card will be issued to families below the poverty line, while those above the poverty line will receive a Green Card

title: Duraimurugan issues apology to persons with disabilities over offensive remarks
content: Mr. Duraimurugan said: “I was shocked, and I regret it. It is wrong that someone who was nurtured by Kalaignar did this.”

title: Bengal teachers who lost jobs hold march demanding release of OMR sheets
content: A large police contingent, including personnel from the Rapid Action Force, was deployed to prevent the rally from reaching the SSC Bhawan.

title: West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari visits clash-hit Mothabari in Malda
content: "Keep faith in the law," Suvendu Adhikari told the affected families, while asking them to stay united

title: Sivaji Ganesan’s bungalow case: Elder son Ramkumar files affidavit in favour of brother Prabhu
content: However, a finance company expresses doubts whether Mr. Ramkumar would have actually relinquished all his rights over the property worth several crores of rupees

title: Tahawwur Rana extradition: 2008 Mumbai attack accused back in India after 17 years | Timeline
content: A team led by NIA authorities landed in India late Thursday with Rana who will now face justice for his role and involvement in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks carried out by Pakistan based terrorists.

title: Missing since March 29, Hungarian tourist’s body found in Meghalaya
content: Police said Puskas Zsolt, suffering from rheumatoid arthritis, may have slipped and fallen from a path off the usual trekking trails in the Sohra-Shella area

title: Kerala court sentences man to life for raping COVID-19 patient in ambulance
content: Principal Sessions Court in Pathanamthitta orders convict, Noufal of Kayamkulam, to pay a fine of ₹2.12 lakh

title: One terrorist killed, Kishtwar ops enters 3rd day, says Army
content: According to the Army, the joint operations in Chenab Valley’s Kishtwar in J&K has been going on from April 9.

title: Employment Linked Incentive scheme: Rahul Gandhi slams PM Modi; says ‘another jumla’
content: Rahul Gandhi said jobs can't be created by focussing only on large corporates, promoting cronies over fair-play businesses, prioritising assembly over production, and disregarding India's indigenous skills

title: Self-immolation bid by two near Bapatla railway station, one critical
content: The two persons were identified as Lakshminarayana, 67, a retired railway employee, and Nallamothu Madhavi aged 56.

title: QB Flacco rejoining Browns on one-year contract
content: Joe Flacco is returning to Cleveland, where he won the NFL's Comeback Player of the Year award in 2023.

title: Source: Pitre, Texans agree to 3-year, $39M deal
content: Nickel cornerback Jalen Pitre and the Houston Texans have agreed to a three-year, $39 million contract extension with $30 million guaranteed, a source told ESPN.

title: Ja doing grenade celebration until it's 'a problem'
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant, recently fined for mimicking pointing a long gun after a 3-pointer, said mimicking a grenade toss was "my celebration now until somebody else has a problem with it, and I'll find another one."

title: Fever, Clark vs. Sky, Reese top WNBA Rivals Wk.
content: Caitlin Clark and the Indiana Fever will square off against Angel Reese and the Chicago Sky in primetime to tip off the inaugural WNBA Rivals Week in August.

title: No. 7 PG recruit Lewis decommits from Kentucky
content: Acaden Lewis, the No. 7-ranked point guard in the 2025 class, decommitted from Kentucky, he told ESPN on Thursday.

title: NFL draft prospect Bond surrenders on warrant
content: NFL draft prospect Isaiah Bond turned himself in on an outstanding sexual assault warrant Thursday morning, the Frisco (Texas) Police Department confirmed to ESPN.

title: WMU wins in 2OT, plays BU for Frozen Four title
content: Owen Michaels's double-overtime goal sent Western Michigan to the Frozen Four title game, where it will face Boston University on Saturday night.

title: Salah signs two-year Liverpool contract extension
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has signed a contract extension, ending monthslong uncertainty over his future at Anfield, the club announced.

title: 'Everybody in the organization was miserable': Inside the Nuggets' shocking dual firings
content: With less than a week left in the regular season, Denver fired its head coach and GM, ending a yearslong cold war, and risking the NBA's most precious commodity: the prime of three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Golf's everyman hero hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for every team's 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: Mock draft: Who comes after No. 1 Paige Bueckers?
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith and Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: Georgia, Florida and Miami among teams hitting the field
content: Spring games aren't as plentiful as they have been, but several big-name schools are in action this weekend.

title: Bayern, Dortmund cannot afford to lose
content: Saturday's Klassiker isn't first vs. second, but Bayern and Dortmund's seasons hinge on their rivalry match.

title: Slot: Salah's new Liverpool deal took huge 'effort'

title: Two fans die in Chile before Libertadores match
content: Two fans died on Thursday before the start of a Copa Libertadores match between Colo Colo and Fortaleza near Santiago's estadio Monumental.

title: Ronaldo launches film studio with famed filmmaker
content: Cristiano Ronaldo has joined forces with British filmmaker Matthew Vaughn to launch an independent film studio.

title: MLS won't switch to fall/spring schedule before '27
content: MLS has announced that the league will explore a switch to its schedule that would align with the international soccer calendar as early as 2027, as well as possible changes to the format of the regular season and playoffs

title: Amorim 'really confident' in Onana despite gaffes

title: USMNT, Mexico learn Gold Cup group opponents
content: The United States landed in Group D alongside Haiti, Trinidad and Tobago and Saudi Arabia in Thursday's Concacaf Gold Cup draw, while champions Mexico were placed into Group A with Costa Rica, Suriname, and Dominican Republic.

title: Star exits, coaching changes, lawsuits: After awful 2024, San Diego is rebounding
